intro: Ononis lingulata, commonly known as narrowleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with red or purple at the base. Its flowers are clustered in loose, cylindrical inflorescences, with each flower having five pink or reddish petals. Ononis lingulata thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as coastal dunes and disturbed areas.
